metadata.name: Arbitrary DLL or Csproj Code Execution Via Dotnet.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects execution of arbitrary DLLs or unsigned code via a ".csproj" files via Dotnet.EXE.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\dotnet.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('.net host') AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.csproj')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.csproj"')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dll')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dll"')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.csproj''')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dll'''))))

output.summary: Detects execution of arbitrary DLLs or unsigned code via a ".csproj" files via Dotnet.EXE.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administrator usage References: https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/OtherMSBinaries/Dotnet/, https://twitter.com/_felamos/status/1204705548668555264, https://bohops.com/2019/08/19/dotnet-core-a-vector-for-awl-bypass-defense-evasion/
